content: Yes, being a lady-in-waiting was highly desirable for women in the past, especially for those coming from noble families. It was considered a prestigious position that brought honor and social status to the family of the lady-in-waiting. The role provided access to exclusive events, travel opportunities, and a chance to meet important people. It also provided valuable experience in the courtly and political life of the time, which could prove beneficial in securing a good marriage or advancing one's social status. Furthermore, it was an opportunity for women to demonstrate their loyalty, service, and devotion to the queen or princess they served, which was highly valued in the patriarchal society of the past. Therefore, being a lady-in-waiting was highly coveted by women who wanted to make their mark in society and rise to the top of the social ladder.
